title: Simulation of Protein Synthesis
description: My senior project for my time at Rochester Institute of Technology. This has involved working on a team to redesign an existing product used by college students and professionals to simulate and analyze protein structure and function.
content:
This senior project involved reimagining and modernizing a critical educational tool used for protein structure analysis. The application allows users to visualize complex protein structures, simulate protein folding processes, and analyze protein-protein interactions in a user-friendly interface.

Working with a team of four software engineers, we completely redesigned the user experience while maintaining the scientific accuracy that made the original tool valuable to students and researchers.

The new version includes interactive 3D protein models, real-time simulation controls, and the ability to export analysis results for further research.

title: World Construct
description: This application is intended to be used as a source to organize, sort and distribute information related to any setting, whether it be a D&D campaign or any other work.
content:
World Construct is a comprehensive world-building tool designed for writers, game masters, and creative minds. This application helps users organize and manage vast amounts of information about fictional worlds, characters, locations, and plot elements.

As a personal project, World Construct allowed me to explore database design for complex hierarchical data, implement advanced search and filtering capabilities, and create an intuitive UI for managing interconnected content.

The application features a hierarchical organization system, relationship mapping between entities, custom tagging, and export options for various formats.

title: Recipe Cards
description: Individual assignment done during my time at Ecolab. Developed a prototype system for a potential future product. Worked with company stakeholders to ensure it was up to their standards and incorporated feedback from meetings.
content:
During my internship at Ecolab, I was tasked with designing and prototyping a Recipe Cards application that would streamline the creation and sharing of standardized protocols in industrial settings.

This project involved extensive stakeholder interviews, competitive analysis, and multiple rounds of design reviews to ensure the final product would meet the needs of field technicians and managers.

The design emphasizes clarity, ease of use in industrial environments, and compatibility with existing Ecolab systems. I created high-fidelity mockups and interactive prototypes that were used to secure funding for further development.

title: Reddit Sentiment Analysis
description: Built from the ground up an application to process the user sentiment of posts on Reddit. Worked together in a team of 5 individuals using Git and AWS Technologies, including DynamoDB, AWS Comprehend, API Gateway, and Terraform.
content:
This educational project focused on analyzing sentiment trends across different Reddit communities. Our team developed a serverless application that collects posts from specified subreddits, processes them using AWS Comprehend for sentiment analysis, and stores the results in DynamoDB.

My primary responsibilities included building the data processing pipeline, implementing the sentiment analysis logic, and creating visualizations to present our findings.

The application provides real-time sentiment tracking, historical trend analysis, and comparative metrics across different communities. We used infrastructure as code principles with Terraform to ensure consistent deployments across environments.
